page.title: 19Burscough-Present-Problems
page.content: Amongst current local issues are concern over a proposed Burscough by-pass road,pressures on farming,and local unemployment. Work is due to start in 1987 on building a by-pass through the study area.In October 1985 Mrs Chalker the Transport Secretary visited the local industrial estate.Based here are a number of local firms such as:-Firwood timber supplies,Haulage Contracters, Hill's motor car body sales,Hudson's tractor repairs.She told the local newspaper that although the estate had brought some distress it has also brought much needed jobs."What would be an ideal solution would be a direct accessfrom the industrial estate to the by-pass".Local farmers challenge that a by-pass for Burscough is neccessary at all.
